question_text: Select two characteristics of recursive DNS resolution:
answer_options: The DNS server returns a referral to another DNS server
The DNS server fully resolves the request and returns the final IP address
The client performs the entire resolution chain itself
The DNS server queries other servers on behalf of the client
It can only be performed by root name servers
correct_answer: The DNS server fully resolves the request and returns the final IP address
The DNS server queries other servers on behalf of the client
explanation: In recursive resolution, the DNS server does the work of querying upstream servers and returns the final result to the client.
